```blocks
    music.playMelody("- - - - - - - - ", 120)
})
```

## 🦃 Turkey Talks @showdialog
*Tell us what you're thankful for!*  🤗

---

Follow along to code a game where a character collects falling objects to reveal 
one thing they are thankful for!

![Title](thanksgivingDemo.gif)

## Intro
✋ *Welcome! Let's take a minute to preview the project.* ✋

---

Click the **Game Window** tab above.

*You'll use this tab whenever you need to click ▶ and preview the project!*

---

Click the **Next** button to get started.

## Step 2
🦃 **Code player movement** 🦃

---
- :game: Open the ``||controller.Controller||`` menu and drag a ``||controller.move [mySprite]||``
block into *the end* of the ``||loops.on start||`` container.
- :mouse pointer: Click on the ``||sprite.[mySprite]||`` bubble and select **turkey** 
from the drop-down menu.

---

*Click ▶ and use the directional buttons to move the turkey sprite.*


## Step 3
🍂**Code the falling collectible** 🍂
*Setup* 

--- 
- :circle: Open the ``||game.Game||`` menu and drag a ``||game.on game update every [] ms||`` 
block into an empty spot on the coding canvas.


- :paper plane: Open the ``||sprites.Sprites||`` menu and drag a ``||sprite.set [projectile] from side||`` into the ``||game.on game update||`` container.

---

*Tip: Use the 💡 to see if you're on the right track!*

```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(500, function () {
    projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSide(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, 50, 50)
})
```

## Step 4
🍂 **Code the falling collectible** 🍂
*Sprite Creation* 

---
- :mouse pointer: In the ``||sprite.set [projectile] to||`` block, click the 
**grey oval** to open the Sprite Edior.

🎨 Create your own sprite, or click on the **Gallery Tab** at the top 
to choose one from the gallery.  Click the green **Done** button when you've finished.

---

*Click ▶ to see the sprite move across the screen every 500 milliseconds (ms).*

## Step 5
🍂 **Code the falling collectible** 🍂 
*Parameter Changes* 

---
- :mouse pointer: In the ``||sprite.set [projectile] to||`` block, change ``||sprites.vx||`` 
to **0**.  Test out different numbers for ``||sprites.vy||``!


- :mouse pointer: In the ``||game.on game update every [] ms||`` container, click on **500** 
and test out different values from the drop-down.

---

*Click ▶ to see how changing these parameters effects the projectile sprite.*

## Step 6
🍂 **Code the falling collectible** 🍂 *Randomness* 

---
- :paper plane: Open the ``||sprites.Sprites||`` menu and drag a ``||sprites.set position||`` 
block into *the end* of the ``||game.on game update||`` container.

- :mouse pointer: Click on the ``||sprite.[mySprite]||`` bubble and select **projectile** 
from the drop-down.
 
### @diffs false
```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(2000, function () {
    let projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSide(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . e e . 
        . . . . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e . . 
        . . . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e . . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 7 7 e e 7 7 . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e 7 7 7 . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 e e 7 7 7 7 . . 
        . . . . 7 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 . . . 
        . . . 7 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . 
        . . . 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . 
        . . 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . 
        . . 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . . . 
        . . 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, 0, 50)
    projectile.setPosition(0, 0)
})
```

## Step 7
🍂 **Code the falling collectible** 🍂 *Randomness* 

---
- :calculator: Open the ``||math.Math||`` menu and drag a ``||math.pick random||`` 
bubble into the ``||sprites.x||`` parameter bubble.

- :tree: Open the ``||scene.Scene||`` menu and drag a ``||scene.screen width||`` 
bubble into the **2nd** parameter bubble in ``||math.pick random||``.

---

*Use the 💡 to see if you're on the right track!*

### @diffs true
```blocks
game.onUpdateInterval(2000, function () {
    let projectile = sprites.createProjectileFromSide(img`
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . e e . 
        . . . . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e . . 
        . . . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e . . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 7 7 e e 7 7 . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 7 e e 7 7 7 . . 
        . . . . . 7 7 7 e e 7 7 7 7 . . 
        . . . . 7 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 . . . 
        . . . 7 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . 
        . . . 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . 
        . . 7 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . 
        . . 7 e 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . . . 
        . . 7 7 7 7 7 7 . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 
        `, 0, 50)
    projectile.setPosition(randint(0, scene.screenWidth()), 0)
})
```

## Step 8
🤗 **Code your thankful thoughts** 🤗 *On Overlap* 

---
- :paper plane: Open the ``||sprites.Sprites||`` menu and drag a ``||sprites.on [sprite] of kind overlaps||`` 
container into an empty spot on the coding canvas.
- :mouse pointer: Click on the **2nd** ``||sprites.[Player]||`` bubble and select 
**Projectile** from the drop-down.

```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    
})
```

## Step 9
🤗 **Code your thankful thoughts** 🤗 *On Overlap* 

---
- :paper plane: Open the ``||sprites.Sprites||`` menu and drag a ``||sprites.destroy [mySprite]||`` 
block into the ``||sprites.on [sprite] overlap||`` container.
- :mouse pointer: Click and drag on the ``||sprite.[otherSprite]||`` bubble into the ``||sprite.[mySprite]||`` 
parameter.

```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    otherSprite.destroy()
})
```

## Step 10
🤗 **Code your thankful thoughts** 🤗 *Speaking Sprites* 

---
- :paper plane: Open the ``||sprites.Sprites||`` menu and drag a ``||sprites.[mySprite] say||`` 
block into ``||sprites.on [sprite] overlaps||``.  
- :mouse pointer: In the ``||sprites.on [sprite] overlap||`` container, click and drag on the ``||sprite.[sprite]||`` 
bubble to replace ``||sprite.[mySprite]||``.  

Type something in the block that you're thankful for.  Click the white **+** sign 
to change how long it appears on screen.

---

*Click ▶ and see the turkey speak when it overlaps with a falling object.*

```blocks
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    otherSprite.destroy()
    sprite.sayText(":)", 500, false)
})
```

## Step 11
🤗 **Code your thankful thoughts** 🤗 *Array of Thanks* 

---
- :list: Click on **Advanced**.  Open the ``||arrays.Arrays||`` menu and drag a ``||sprite.set [text list] to||`` 
block into the *end* of the ``||loops.on start||`` container.

**Add more things you're thankful for!**

In each parameter bubble, add a thing you're thankful for *(you can include the one you just used!)*.
Use the white **+** sign to add even more!

```blocks
    .....feeeeeef.....
    ....fec11c11ef....

    .f66ffe2555ef999f.

    .fceebeeeeeeeeef..

    ...feeeeeeeeeef...
    ....ff4fff4fff....
    ....f44f.f44f.....
    ....fff...fff.....
    `, SpriteKind.Player)

let textSprite = textsprite.create("I'm thankful for...")
textSprite.setPosition(81, 110)
controller.moveSprite(turkey)
let text_list = ["friends", "family", "food"]
```

## Step 12
🤗 **Code your thankful thoughts** 🤗 *Array of Thanks* 

---
- :list: Click on **Advanced**.  Open the ``||arrays.Arrays||`` menu and drag a 
``||arrays.get random value||`` bubble into the text parameter of the ``||sprites.[sprite] say||`` 
block.
- :mouse pointer: Click on the ``||sprite.[list]||`` bubble and select **text list** from 
the drop-down.

---

*Click ▶ and see the turkey say a random item from your array of thankful things.*

```blocks
let text_list = ["friends", "family", "food"]
sprites.onOverlap(SpriteKind.Player, SpriteKind.Projectile, function (sprite, otherSprite) {
    otherSprite.destroy()
    sprite.sayText(text_list._pickRandom(), 500, false)
})
```

**Final Touches**: *Explore the ``||music.Music||`` menu to add sound to your project!*

## Use as Extension

This repository can be added as an **extension** in MakeCode.

* open [https://arcade.makecode.com/](https://arcade.makecode.com/)
* click on **New Project**
* click on **Extensions** under the gearwheel menu
* search for **https://github.com/sbannoncn/thanksgiving-** and import

## Edit this project ![Build status badge](https://github.com/sbannoncn/thanksgiving-/workflows/MakeCode/badge.svg)

To edit this repository in MakeCode.

* open [https://arcade.makecode.com/](https://arcade.makecode.com/)
* click on **Import** then click on **Import URL**
* paste **https://github.com/sbannoncn/thanksgiving-** and click import
